info.game_comments:
Ken Jennings game 3.

(Jimmy: During the Depression, some people were very busy beavers building the Hoover Dam.  We'll tell you about it, coming up next on Jeopardy!)

jeopardy_round: IF YOU'RE GOING TO DO IT...

(1, 1).clue: During the War of 1812 this "Rip Van Winkle" author wrote biographies of naval commanders

(2, 1).clue: Before winning the World Heavyweight title, he said he wasn't "the greatest; I'm the double greatest"

(3, 1).clue: It's the northernmost & smallest of the 3 Baltic nations

(3, 2).clue: Get all your shots before you canoe down this small Congo river with the same name as a deadly hemorrhagic virus

(4, 2).clue: To score 2 points at once in pro football the offense has a 2-point conversion & the defense has this

(6, 2).clue: Completes the title of Jeffrey Steingarten's book "It Must Have Been Something I ..."

(3, 3).clue: Napoleon could tell you it's the largest island in Italy's Tuscan Archipelago

(3, 4).clue: In the 9th & 10th centuries, Danish Norsemen controlled a region called the Danelaw in this country

(4, 4).clue: You mix, then heat, lime, silica, alumina & iron oxide with gypsum to create the Portland type of this

(6, 4).clue: It means "toward the bow", you landlubber

(2, 5).clue: Vince Lombardi declared that "Winning isn't everything, it's" this

(2, 1).clue: The successor of Charlemagne as king of the Franks was the first of 18 French kings with this name

(3, 1).clue: Known as the caribou in North America, this Arctic deer is domesticated in some polar regions

(4, 1).clue: Going further than vegetarians, I don't eat eggs or wear leather, because I'm one of these

(5, 1).clue: A tale from "The Arabian Nights" tells the story of this person who releases a genie

(6, 1).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports from Hoover Dam.) 2 purposes behind building Hoover Dam were to generate electricity & control flooding on this river
